abstract: The insurer posted lower-than-expected first-quarter earnings and sharply reduced its outlook for 2008, saying fewer businesses and employees were signing up.
snippet: The insurer posted lower-than-expected first-quarter earnings and sharply reduced its outlook for 2008, saying fewer businesses and employees were signing up.
lead_paragraph: UnitedHealth Group, one of the nation’s largest health insurers, disappointed investors on Tuesday by announcing lower-than-expected first-quarter earnings and by sharply reducing its profit outlook for 2008. The company, whose stock plunged on the report, put much of the blame on the weakening economy, saying fewer businesses and employees were signing up for its health insurance.

headline.main: UnitedHealth Misses Forecast and Stock Plunges
